item.title: [PI] Portals?
item.dc:creator: @I_am_Nick I am Nick
item.description:
@I_am_Nick wrote:

1st X = lowest x
2nd X = highest x
1st Y = lowest Y
2nd Y = highest Y

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Portals?
item.dc:creator: @InfectedWhore InfectedWhore
item.description:
@InfectedWhore wrote:

Ah, thank you very much.

Do you know this part;

public boolean inPortal() { return absX >= XXXX && absX <= XXXX && absY >= YYYY && absY <= YYYY; }

Where can I find out more on this? I remember doing it, it’s something to do with the four corners? It was so long ago though.

item.title: [PI] Portals?
item.dc:creator: @InfectedWhore InfectedWhore
item.description:
@InfectedWhore wrote:

How do I put a limit on how many people can go through a portal?

I’ve nearly finished coding a mini-game, but this is the only part I can never seem to get right.

case 2474: for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] == 0) { c.getPA().movePlayer(3363, 3936, 4); } else { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] == 1) { c.getPA().movePlayer(3363, 3936, 4); } else { if (server.playerHandler.players[j] == 2) { c.sendMessage("The Fire match is full!"); } } } } break;

I got that from what I know, but it tells me they’re incomparable types(Server.playerHandler.players and Int).

Can anyone help me?

Thank you,

InfectedWhore.

Read full topic
